name: Best Veggie Burger
description: This is the best veggie burger recipe! These burgers are 100% vegan and grill-able. Hearty, satisfying and flavor packed, even meat eaters will love them!
recipeIngredient: 3 cups cooked black beans (2 15-oz cans, drained and rinsed)
1 cup bread crumbs (*see notes for gluten free)
lettuce, arugula, spinach or other leafy greens

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the ground flax and water. Give it a little stir and set aside. This is your flax egg mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine the ground flax and water. Give it a little stir and set aside. This is your flax egg mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the drained and rinsed black beans. Mash with a potato masher (or fork) until most of the beans are a paste. Leave about 1/4 of the beans whole.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add the drained and rinsed black beans. Mash with a potato masher (or fork) until most of the beans are a paste. Leave about 1/4 of the beans whole.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the cashews in a food processor, and pulse until they are breadcrumb size, NOT a powder. It's okay if a few larger pieces remain. You could instead chop them with a large knife. Add to the bowl with the beans.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the cashews in a food processor, and pulse until they are breadcrumb size, NOT a powder. It's okay if a few larger pieces remain. You could instead chop them with a large knife. Add to the bowl with the beans.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the flax/water mix to the bowl with the beans/nuts as well as all the remaining ingredients. Mix very well with a large wooden spoon.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the flax/water mix to the bowl with the beans/nuts as well as all the remaining ingredients. Mix very well with a large wooden spoon.

recipeInstructions.text: Using about 1/2 cup per burger, shape into burger patty shapes about 3/4 inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Using about 1/2 cup per burger, shape into burger patty shapes about 3/4 inch thick.

itemListElement.text: Add 2-3 tablespoons of oil on the stove over medium heat. Add 4 patties at a time and cook until gold and crispy on one side, about 4 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add 2-3 tablespoons of oil on the stove over medium heat. Add 4 patties at a time and cook until gold and crispy on one side, about 4 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Carefully flip the burgers and cook for 3-4 more minutes. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate.
itemListElement.name: Carefully flip the burgers and cook for 3-4 more minutes. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet or two with parchment paper. Place the patties on the pan(s) and bake for 20 minutes. Flip, bake for 15 more minutes. Remove from oven.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet or two with parchment paper. Place the patties on the pan(s) and bake for 20 minutes. Flip, bake for 15 more minutes. Remove from oven.

itemListElement.text: For easier grilling, refrigerate the patties for at least 30 minutes. Heat the BBQ to medium high, brush the patties with oil and cook for about 4 minutes on each side.
itemListElement.name: For easier grilling, refrigerate the patties for at least 30 minutes. Heat the BBQ to medium high, brush the patties with oil and cook for about 4 minutes on each side.

itemListElement.text: Serve on hamburger buns and any burger fixings you love! Go with the classic: vegan mayo, ketchup, mustard, pickle slices, lettuce, tomato and onion. Or get creative with barbecue sauce, Sriracha vegan mayo, avocado and arugula, etc. Enjoy!
